combinatorics: The study of counting, arrangement, and combination
permutation: Arrangement of objects in a specific order
combination: Selection of items without considering the order
factorial: Product of an integer and all integers below it
binomial coefficient: Number of ways to choose a subset of a set
pigeonhole principle: If 'n' items are put into 'm' containers and n > m, then at least one container must contain more than one item
inclusion exclusion principle: For any two finite sets, the size of their union is the sum of their sizes minus the size of their intersection
cartesian product: Product of multiple sets, resulting in set of all ordered pairs
power set: Set of all subsets of a set
partition: A division of a set into non-overlapping subsets
bell number: Number of ways to partition a set
stirling number: Number of ways to partition a set into non-empty subsets
catalan number: Number of certain types of lattice paths, permutations, binary trees, etc
set: A collection of distinct objects, considered as an object in its own right
subset: A set that contains only elements found in a certain other set
union: The set of all distinct elements in all given sets
intersection: The set of all elements that are in all given sets
difference: The set of all elements in one set that are not in another set
complement: The set of all elements not in a given set
